subject: Leadership
title: Communication as Legacy
description: A short lesson to help you apply Communication as Legacy.

hook.text: Lincoln's Gettysburg Address was 272 words. The other speaker that day talked for two hours. Nobody remembers him.

buildup.text: Great leaders are remembered for their words. Churchill, King, Mandelaâ€”their words shaped history and moved millions.

discovery.text: Legacy isn't grand speeches. It's daily messages that shape culture, values, and how people treat each other.

twist.text: Your team will forget most of what you say. They'll remember how you made them feel in the moments that mattered.

climax.text: Invest in your words. Write the key email with care. Prepare tough conversations. Every message is a leadership moment.

punchline.text: Legacies live not in what you built but in what you said and how.

quiz.question: What makes communication a leadership legacy?
options: Daily messages that shape culture and values
